DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior Disease or Disorder Systemic Antibiotic Antiviral Therapy Eligibility Determination Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable indicator whether a person has had a prior disease or disorder requiring the administration of systemic antibiotics, a drug used to treat infections caused by bacteria and other microorganisms, or antiviral therapy, treatment of viral infections with agents that prevent viral replication in infected cells without impairing the host cell function, as factor used to determine enrollment in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior Disease or Disorder Systemic Antibiotic Antiviral Therapy Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having had a prior disease or disorder requiring the administration of systemic antibiotics, a drug used to treat infections caused by bacteria and other microorganisms, or antiviral therapy, treatment of viral infections with agents that prevent viral replication in infected cells without impairing the host cell function, as factor used to determine enrollment in a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Prior Disease or Disorder Systemic Antibiotic Antiviral Therapy Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:(sis-TEM-ik) Affecting the entire body.:(an-tih-by-AH-tik) A drug used to treat infections caused by bacteria and other microorganisms.:Treatment of viral infections with agents that prevent viral replication in infected cells without impairing the host cell function.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Substances naturally produced by microorganisms or their derivatives that selectively target microorganisms not humans. Antibiotics kill or inhibit the growth of microorganisms by targeting components of the microbial cell absent from human cells, including bacterial cell walls, cell membrane, and 30S or 50S ribosomal subunits. These substances are used in the treatment of bacterial and other microbial infections.
Treatment of viral infections with agents that prevent viral replication in infected cells without impairing the host cell function.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NSABP CRF:National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Case Report Form

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a known his
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known history of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), Hepatitis B, and/or Hepatitis C (no additional laboratory tests for HIV, Hepatitis B, or Hepatitis C are required for screening)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV), active or chronic hepatitis (i.e., quantifiable HBV-DNA and/or positive HbsAg, quantifiable HCV-RNA) or known history of HCV or HBV without documented resolution?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have documented HIV infection or positive serology, active bacterial infections, serologic or PCR evidence for active or chronic hepatitis B or hepatitis C?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV), active or chronic hepatitis (i.e., quantifiable HBV-DNA and/or positive HbsAg, quantifiable HCV-RNA) or known history of HCV, HBV or HIV?
